intro: Psychotria subherbacea, commonly known as the "herbaceous psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Psychotria subherbacea is also noted for its potential psychoactive properties due to the presence of certain alkaloids.
